poem:
*The Unlikely Star*

From a field of destiny's misfits,  
emerges a homely hero,  
a late bloomer in a world of  
tinsel crowns and glinting lights.  
Beyond the scripted fate,  
his voice—gravelly, raw—  
claims the stage, defying odds,  
wearing the wrinkles of time  
as badges of an enduring passion.  
The curtain falls, softly shuffled.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gene Hackman obituary Few of Hollywood’s leading actors made such an unlikely journey to stardom as Gene Hackman, who has died aged 95. He had no early contact with show business, came from a fraught family background and had looks that might generously be described as “homely”. He did not decide on acting as a career until his late 20s and was in his late 30s when he had his breakthrough, as the elder brother". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
